PropertyList.title: LZ-129 Hindenburg

key.name: W
key.desc: Weigh-off to 10% of current weight by dropping ballast. (Takes about 10 seconds and only works on ground.)

key.name: w
key.desc: Get current weight balance report. (Too precise!)

key.name: R
key.desc: Switch the direction of the selected engines. An engine must be stopped before changing direction.

key.name: Y
key.desc: Release mooring mast connection or wire.

key.name: U
key.desc: Attach mooring wire. Only possible within 1500 feet of the mooring mast.

PropertyList.text:
Handling instructions
Take-off Check initial static condition (w). Weight off (W) once or twice. Drop some ballast fore (A) and aft (D) if needed. Release the mooring (Y) when the ship is 1000 lbs or more light. Start engines once the airship is 150 - 200 ft above ground.
Approach: Slow and against the wind at 500 - 900 ft. Adjust the static condition to be close (within ~1000lbs) of equilibrium. Gas: (F)(G) wait a second (f)(g). Ballast (A|a) (D|d). Setting (some of) the engines to reverse (R) allows braking.
Landing (US Navy style): Attach mooring wire (U) when 200 - 400 ft down-wind of the mast. Forward speed should be very low at this point and the altitude about 400 ft. Slowly winch in the mooring wire (u) until the ship is attached to the mooring mast. Beware of oscillations.
